events.name: Continuous Integration using Jenkins with source code on GitHub
events.description: Synopsis When one of our products moved their source control from TFS to GitHub, the team also decided to use Jenkins for their new Continuous Integration automation. In this session we'll see how we used the Jenkins Git plugin to integrate the product's sources with it's build automation, setup GitHub webhooks such that a Jenkins CI build is triggered everytime a change is pushed to GitHub, build specific branches and push build file changes back to GitHub during each build. Also see how we used the GitHub Pull Request builder plugin to build PRs and report status back to GitHub. Agenda 6.30pm to 7.00pm Eat, drink & chit-chat7.00pm to 8.30pm Talk: CI using Jenkins with source code on GitHub8.30pm to 9.00pm Q&A Speaker's Profile Lata KopalleSoftware Build & Release EngineerAutodesk, Singapore. Lata is a Software Build & Release Engineer with Autodesk, Singapore. She has used Jenkins for over six years - administering several Masters, setting up and advising on Continuous Integration Pipelines on Jenkins. She has been a Release Engineer for over 12 years.  *** Note: This meetup is free for all to attend ***
events.location: Titansoft Pte Ltd, 150 Cantonment Road #02-08, Cantonment Centre Block B, Singapore

events.name: ProductTank #6: Agile in modern product organizations (fireside chat)
events.description:
RSVP ON EVENTBRITE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/producttank-6-agile-in-modern-product-organizations-fireside-chat-tickets-28978541598 === ProductTank is ending 2016 with a cozy fireside chat about Agile in modern product organizations. Our guests  for the evening are Jordan Dea-Mattson, Nuno Jonet, and Varun Mittal — together they have close to 50 years of cumulative product management experience. 



THEME: AGILE IN MODERN PRODUCT ORGANIZATIONS Agile Software Development is a deep (and deeply misunderstood) topic. Some companies swear by it, and some, not being able to implement any of the methodologies properly, diss it. 


PANELISTS Jordan Dea-Mattson, VP of Engineering / TradeGecko Jordan is an experienced technologist who started his career in software engineering before most of the people in the Singapore tech ecosystem were even born. He spent over a decade at Apple, a large chunk of his career at Adobe and Yahoo, where he worked on large infrastructural projects. He recently joined TradeGecko as a VP of Engineering and is currently on a quest to evangelize better engineering practices in the Singaporean tech community. Nuno Jonet, Director of Product Management / PocketMath Nuno is a veteran enterprise and fintech product manager. Earlier in his career, he had a chance to work with Lockheed Martin, Fusion Garage, and Standard Chartered. Varun Mittal, Regional Head of Operations & Merchant Product / helloPay, Alibaba & Lazada Group Varun is an experienced fintech product manager, who spent most of his career working on an implementation of various payment systems. 


Moderator: Uttam Chopra, Director of Product Management, Yahoo! Asia Pacific. 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank. 19:05 - 20:20 - Fireside chat and Q&A. 20:20 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. 


Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • RSVPs will close at 01:00am on Wednesday, November 16. • Remember to bring your ID for a smooth check-in with the building security. :) • IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break.

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning with TensorFlow
events.description: Synopsis: Over the past few years, machine learning has gained widespread popularity in a number of disciplines and changed the way we interact and use real-world data to provide insights that are otherwise not directly available for us to leverage.  In this talk, we will have an interactive tutorial session using the Google's TensorFlow to run common operations and further discuss what it takes to design a machine learning algorithm. We will take a look at how to perform prediction using time series data, classify images and text using TensorFlow. At the same time, to introduce Cloud ML. Google Cloud Machine Learning is a managed service that enables you to easily build machine learning models, that work on any type of data, of any size. More details will be shared nearer the talk; meanwhile if you have friends/ colleagues who are into machine learning, this session will be interesting for you ! Karthik M Swamy will be leading the talk, he is a machine learning and computer vision researcher.  TensorFlow tutorials to be used in the session are available at: https://github.com/karthikmswamy/TFTutorials Installation instructions for TensorFlow for different platforms are available at: https://github.com/karthikmswamy/TFTutorials/blob/master/README.md Useful links :  Tensorflow - http://www.tensorflow.orgCloud ML - https://cloud.google.com/ml/
events.location: Mapletree business City II , 70 Pasir Panjang Road #03-01 Singapore 117371
events.group_name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore
